review: It does not work about 10% of the time.  I have two of them, and they just don't work right.  Constant failures when using netflix and Hulu....videos refuse to play and images do not load.  I even have issues with iTunes movies that I have purchased.  Many times I use my iPad and share the screen to my appletv...this sometimes gets around the error...but even the screen sharing is hit and miss.  When they don't work I take it as a sign that I do not need to be watching tv.
author: Blake

review: I have an all Apple ecosystem at home, which I love, but this is without a doubt the worst product Apple has ever made. The Apple TV never recognizes my devices, or vice versa. I've spent so much time on their troubleshooting page which is equally useless.
author: Injustus

review: I like my Apple TV.  Works well with my iTunes movie library (although there have been three occasions when I had to reboot because  "server was unavailable"--it became available signing out and signing back in).  I also love my Amazon Prime, which I probably use more, and Flixster, which has most of the Ultra Violet movies (some of which are iTunes linked, some like Sony and Fox, which aren't) received as digital copies.  I just wish I could watch my iTunes library on Amazon, and my Amazon library on iTunes, and my Ultra Violet movies on both in a way better than now.  They really need to share platforms.  (Does it really matter where the movie comes from?)
author: BlueBonneville
